replies.msg:
I would like to know how did you practise the ielts? Practise past paper or buy some books? I am weak at listening, it is too fast for me to listen and i cannot catch up the answer. I just got band 6 in ielts exam. How can i improve the ielts exam? any practising exercise advice?

p.s. I have bought some ielts exercise from 淘寶

1. Make good use of the time (30s) before the recording plays.
Use this period of time to go through the questions
Highlight / circle the key words
briefly take a look at the ans (for mc) or try to guess the ans (for short ans)
this helps you to quickly identify the ans in the recording

2. try not to write the ans down right after you heard it.
instead, listen and wait until the the speaker finishes the sentence.
Understand what the speaker says.

Thx for your recommendation, I always have some spelling mistake and forget how to spell the words

The easiest part to get started with is the writing task
The short writing task is somewhat similar to the HKDSE LS data response questions. Try to read more model essays and focus on how high achievers summarise and present the data. The long task is about showing the marker the diversity of your vocabulary. Read more band 8 or 9 essays. It's always the key.

As for listening, u need both the tape and the transcript. Listen to the audio alongside the text, it can help you get used to the typical pace of speech in ielts exams and how the speakers pronounce each word. U need to work on the listening task but only listen to the tapes and treat them as learning materials.

Go to piratebay and get some copies of the cambridge ietls practice books. If you're currently around band 6, u can start with book 4 or 5.
I achieved some decent grades in ielts and tofle with the help from the prep books from tpb and occasional tutorials.
